means: 抓住
逮捕
捉拿
俘获
夺取
占领
起获
没收

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"抓住，捕捉"之意。
means: arrest ：指根据法律或命令进行逮捕并予以监禁或拘留。
capture ：指通过武力或计谋等，战胜抵抗而捉住敌人或动物。
catch ：普通用词，指捉住跑动或隐藏中的人或动物，一般指活捉。
seize ：侧重指以突然、有力地动作迅速抓住或捉住。
trap ：多指诱捕。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"抓住，握紧"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: take, grasp, grab, grip, clasp, clutch, snatch, seize
means: take ： 最普通用词，不带感情色彩。指用手抓、取某东西或控制某物。
grasp ： 指紧紧抓住、抓牢。
grab ： 指粗暴而急迫的抓住。
grip ： 语气比grasp强，指用手的最大力量紧紧抓住。
clasp ： 指用手紧握或用臂紧抱。
clutch ： 强调匆忙、紧急地抓、抓紧。
snatch ： 指突然抢走，侧重动作更快或更具暴力性质。
seize ： 指突然抓住某物，强调突然的猛烈动作。

sentence.Network_en: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys. Make your lives extraordinary.
sentence.Network_cn: 人生就应该是快乐的，要抓住每一天，孩子们，让你们的生活变得非凡起来。

sentence.Network_en: Army officers plotted a failed attempt yesterday to seize power.
The government now hopes to seize the initiative on education.
sentence.Network_cn: 如今政府希望抓住教育上的主动权。

jx.jx_en_mean: make the most of the present moment. carpe diem
take eager advantage of (something); exploit for one's own purposes

lj.lj_ly: the government has eagerly seized on the evidence to deny any link between deprivation and crime.
lj.lj_ls: 政府急切地利用这一证据否认剥夺和犯罪之间有任何联系。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French seizir 'give seisin', from medieval Latin sacire, in the phrase ad proprium sacire 'claim as one's own', from a Germanic base meaning 'procedure'

entry.def: If you seize something, you take hold of it quickly, firmly, and forcefully.

example.ex: 'Leigh,' he said seizing my arm to hold me back.
example.tran: “莉，”他说着一把抓住我的胳膊把我拉了回来。

entry.tran: (通过暴力突然迅速地)夺取，攻占，控制
entry.def: When a group of people seize a place or seize control of it, they take control of it quickly and suddenly, using force.

example.ex: Troops have seized the airport and railroad terminals...
example.tran: 军队已控制了机场和火车站。

example.ex: Army officers plotted a failed attempt yesterday to seize power.

entry.tran: (通常指通过武力)起获，没收，扣押
entry.def: If a government or other authority seize someone's property, they take it from them, often by force.

example.ex: Police were reported to have seized all copies of this morning's edition of the newspaper...
example.tran: 据说警方已经将该报纸今天的早间版全部没收。

example.ex: Bailiffs need a certificate from the county court to seize goods for rent arrears.
example.tran: 查封官需要有郡法院的证明才能没收货物以抵欠租。

entry.def: When someone is seized, they are arrested or captured.

example.ex: UN officials say two military observers were seized by the Khmer Rouge yesterday...
example.tran: 联合国官员称昨天有两名军事观察员被红色高棉逮捕。

example.ex: Men carrying sub-machine guns seized the five soldiers and drove them away.
example.tran: 持冲锋枪的几名男子俘虏了 5 名士兵并开车将他们带走。

entry.def: When you seize an opportunity, you take advantage of it and do something that you want to do.

example.ex: During the riots hundreds of people seized the opportunity to steal property...
example.tran: 在暴乱中成百上千的人纷纷趁机偷窃财物。

example.ex: The government now hopes to seize the initiative on education.
example.tran: 如今政府希望抓住教育上的主动权。

sentences.sentence: "The salesclerk quickly seized the money on the counter"
"The mother seized her child by the arm"
"Birds of prey often seize small mammals"
"The rebels threaten to seize civilian hostages"

means.word_mean: 3. take possession of by force, as after an invasion;

sentences.sentence: "the invaders seized the land and property of the inhabitants"

means.word_mean: 4. take temporary possession of as a security, by legal authority;

sentences.sentence: "The customs agents impounded the illegal shipment"

means.word_mean: 5. seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession;

sentences.sentence: "He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town"
"She seized control of the throne after her husband died"

means.word_mean: 6. hook by a pull on the line;

sentences.sentence: "The patient was seized with unberable pains"
"He was seized with a dreadful disease"

means.word_mean: 8. capture the attention or imagination of;

auth_sentence.content: Her father would seize Annie for a good-bye kiss.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her father would seize Annie for a good-bye kiss.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her father would seize Annie for a good-bye kiss.

auth_sentence.content: I will...seize on shipping, and embark for Flanders.
auth_sentence.res_content: I will...seize on shipping, and embark for Flanders.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will...seize on shipping, and embark for Flanders.

auth_sentence.content: Seize him,...Rivet him to the rock.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seize him,...Rivet him to the rock.

Sentence.sentence: Seize opportunities to tap their potential.
Sting in the tail Ashby Plant is one of a number of psychologists who seized on Obama's candidacy to test hypotheses about the power of role models
India, China, Japan, and other regions seem to be seizing technological leadership.

sentences.en: Gill seized my hand and shook it heartily.
sentences.cn: 吉尔突然抓住我的手, 热情地和我握手。

sentences.en: The following day mobs seized the Parliament building.
sentences.cn: 第二天暴徒占领了议会大厦。

jushi.english: Police arrested a suspect and seized quantities of drugs.
jushi.chinese: 警察逮捕一名嫌疑犯,查获了大量毒品。

jushi.english: Gill seized my hand and shook it heartily.
jushi.chinese: 吉尔突然抓住我的手,热情地和我握手。
